item.dc:creator: DD32
item.description:
wontfix:

The current implementation for feeds works for me. I'm closing as wontfix due to the fact its impossible to reliably add it to core for dynamic themes.

In the event that someone wants it for a purely static page/site, Then i'd suggest its the place for a plugin, or extra couple of lines in the theme's functions.php.

item.title: Ticket #9364 (Posting Comments in Front Page results in 404) created
item.dc:creator: spikeyslam
item.description:
This problem occurs when the front page and comment paging are set:

Reading Settings > Front page Discussion Settings > Break comments into pages

Posting a comment on

​http://mysite.com/

redirects to: ​http://mysite.com/comment-page-1/#comment-1

which results in a 404 error.

If permalinks are not enabled, it redirects to the Posts page.

To reproduce:

  1. Add comments_template() to Default theme's page.php or use any theme that supports paged comments with pages
  2. Set the front page to a page
  3. Enable paged comments
  4. Post a comment to the front page

item.title: Ticket #9363 (separate "password" word in translations) created
item.dc:creator: gonahkar
item.description:
we have a problem in our Persian translation of WordPress, Persian language is RTL and when we send registeration emails for users, our translation of "password": "رمز" is mixed with the random generated password, because the combination of rtl characters and Latin (English) numbers can not be shown well in LTR format.

because of this we think if the "password" that is used in emails be separated in translation; like this "Password|used in emails" we can solve this problem by not translating this word in emails.

item.title: Ticket #9362 (Quoting issues....) created
item.dc:creator: Paleo Pat
item.description:
Not sure, if this should be under press this or under TinyMCE, But I'll put in both places to be sure.

What is happening is this.

If you try and quote a single paragraph. It works. But if you quote more than one. Like where they are spaces in between. The quote function does not work. I've tried it in FireFox's latest, and with Google Chrome.

Again to be clear, if you high a single paragraph, it will quote it, no problem. But if you try to quote like 3 paragraphs and try to hit the quote function, it does not work.

This happens in the "Press This Screen" and in the normal "Add Post" window, using the rich editor, the standard editor works fine, but it is a bit annoying for we bloggers who do sometimes quote a few paragraphs of a news story or something.

Thanks,

-Pat Owner PoliticalByline.com

P.S. I am running 2.8 bleeding, and this just started as of last build.

Again to be clear, if you high a single paragraph, it will quote it, no problem. But if you try to quote like 3 paragraphs and try to hit the quote function, it does not work.

This happens in the "Press This Screen" and in the normal "Add Post" window, using the rich editor, the standard editor works fine, but it is a bit annoying for we bloggers who do sometimes quote a few paragraphs of a news story or something.

item.title: Ticket #6847 ('the_content_rss' hook not working) updated
item.dc:creator: tadhg
item.description:
westi: You're right about how it should work, but the problem is that apparently the_content_rss hook doesn't always get called--i.e. with Atom or RSS2 feeds. It looks to me like mystyman's patch addresses the problem that's caused by ​http://core.trac.wordpress.org/ticket/8706

I think this bug should be a duplicate of 8706 at this point.

item.title: Ticket #9358 (Define BLOGPATH) created
item.dc:creator: Txanny
item.description:
Some times we need to know the absolute BLOGPATH. This is the one to our blog root and can be different from ABSPATH which points to the WordPress install.

This patch creates the BLOGPATH constant.

item.title: user-edit.php.patch attached to Ticket #9357
item.dc:creator: Txanny
item.description: New filters for custom labels on user profile.

item.title: Ticket #9357 (Filters to change IM names) created
item.dc:creator: Txanny
item.description:
In some blogs, we need to change the IM labels to be shown to administrators and users when editing user profiles. Now we have just the posibility to have AIM, Yahoo or Jabber IM adresses, but some times this are just not the ones our users are using.

For example, we want to have Windows Live, Skype and Google Talk.

One way is to change it on the translations files, but this is just we are using a translation and have to remember to change it every time we update our WordPress.

So, this enhancement proposes to create 3 new filters just for this labels. So we can change them via a filter in our theme or plugin.

The 3 new proposed filters are 'user_label_aim', 'user_label_yahoo' and 'user_label_jabber'.

Patch is provided for this enhancement.

Example usage of feature

Deletes category id 5 and sets all posts to be in 4.

item.title: Ticket #5337 (Wrong timezone with comment_time and the_time since DST ended) closed
item.dc:creator: Viper007Bond
item.description:
invalid:

comment_time() reports what your clock said when you wrote the comment. Changing the timezone setting in your settings does not change that value for past comments.

Use the data from the GMT column in the comments object if you wish to ignore or update the timezone.

item.dc:creator: Rubin110
item.description:
If the issue is because a post contains unicode, it might be because of this one...

​http://rubin110.livejournal.com/515183.html

item.title: Ticket #5362 (WordPress Should Not Check Intra-Site Permalinks for Spam) closed
item.dc:creator: Viper007Bond
item.description:
wontfix:

Gonna mark this as wontfix as there's no way to tell what's safe and what's not.

Say with WordPress.com. You could have a spam blog at spammer.wordpress.com who spammed a ton of other blogs.wordpress.com. Having it be whitelisted allows an opening.

Even the same subdomain could be troublesome as you don't know the blogger owns the whole domain.

In short, plugin material in my opinion.

item.title: Picture 58.png attached to Ticket #9354
item.dc:creator: Rubin110
item.description: Screenshot of error

item.title: Ticket #9354 (LiveJournal import to fresh WP install, XML-RPC Request Failed) created
item.dc:creator: Rubin110
item.description:
Description: After grabbing the bleeding edge of trunk (revision 10811) off of SVN and create more or less a fresh instance of WordPress, attempting to import items from a LiveJournal account through the built in importer fails with an error.

Steps to reproduce:

  1. Grab the latest version of trunk.
  2. Setup the WordPress install.
  3. Attempt to import a LiveJournal account through the built in importer.
  4. Observe.

Expected results: Importer imports all items from LiveJournal with no reported errors.

Actual results: Importer returns with a non end user error and does not import any items. Please see attached screen shot.

Error: XML-RPC Request Failed -- 208: Client error: Invalid text encoding: Cannot display this post. Please see ​http://www.livejournal.com/support/encodings.bml for more information.

Notes: I was directed to create a new ticket here with the bug information by Beau Lebens after emailing him with my issue. He noted that there may be an issue with a post that contains international/non-ascii characters. I will investigate this further. The journal in question is located at ​http://rubin110.livejournal.com .

Side note: This is the first time I'm creating a new ticket for this project. Please let me know if I'm missing anything. Thanks.

item.title: Ticket #3820 (Squid in accelerator mode; Permalink "mod_rewrite" problem.) closed
item.dc:creator: Viper007Bond
item.description:
worksforme:

I use Squid as a reverse proxy on ​http://www.finalgear.com/ with no problems. Since this ticket is over 2 years old and I personally have WordPress working with Squid and Apache with no problems (no idea about the configuration though as I didn't set it up), I'm gonna close it as worksforme. If anyone is still having trouble, please reopen.

) closed
item.dc:creator: Viper007Bond
item.description:
wontfix:

Just use a <div>:

a
b

Note the line spacing between the <div> and the "a" is required though due to unrelated buginess in wpautop() (you'll end up without an opening <p> otherwise).

item.title: post.diff attached to Ticket #9353
item.dc:creator: aldenta
item.description: wp-admin/includes/post.php diff file

item.title: Ticket #9353 (Override default page_template and post_parent) created
item.dc:creator: aldenta
item.description:
In previous versions (not sure where this stopped working but I believe it worked in 2.6) you could override the default page_template and post_parent when creating a new post/page. This was extremely useful when using WP as a CMS. I had custom meta_boxes, would set the page_template to a specific template, set the post_parent to the correct parent, and then hide them with CSS so the user could not change them (hiding doesn't work now either since page_template and page_parent aren't wrapped in their own divs).

Now, based on how get_default_post_to_edit gets called, it sets the defaults and they cannot be changed. The attached diff adds two apply_filters that will allow hooking into this.

Thanks

item.title: Ticket #9352 (Can't view category archive for category with stub of "0") updated
item.dc:creator: Viper007Bond
item.description: This of course requires pretty permalinks to be enabled, otherwise the URL is /?cat=123.

item.title: Ticket #9352 (Can't view category archive for category with stub of "0") updated
item.dc:creator: Viper007Bond
item.description:
Priority, Severity, Summary changed

Actually, it's not using the wrong template, it's just not detecting that a category archive was requested (it's displaying the overall latest posts).

item.title: 9059.patch attached to Ticket #9059
item.dc:creator: Viper007Bond
item.description: Simple but effective workaround

item.title: Ticket #9059 (category with name '0' gets ignored) updated
item.dc:creator: Viper007Bond
item.description:
Keywords, Owner, Component changed

The problem comes from the usage of if ( !empty($variable) ).

And actually there's two problems going on here. Viewing the archive for a category with the stub of 0 doesn't load the archive.php template -- it uses index.php. I've made a separate ticket for that though: #9352

item.title: Ticket #9352 (Can't view category archive for category with stub of "0") created
item.dc:creator: Viper007Bond
item.description: Make a category with the stub of "0" and assign a post to it. If you view the archive listing for that category, index.php is used rather than archive.php.
